website_summaries.verdict: Choose these boat shoes if you prefer a style and build that's a bit more substantial – an ideal shoe for extending your summer activities into the autumn months.
pros: Combination of padded foot bed, interior cushioning, and dual-density bottom provides excellent support
Versatile for casual and dressy wear
cons: Leather isn't as soft or breathable as some others in the Sperry family
Some owners gripe about the leather dye rubbing off on socks
Size discrepancies – may run too small or too large

customer_reviews.title: VERY Disappointed!  I expected better...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe, fits as expected and is reasonably comfortable. The reason I removed one star is that it doesn't provide a lot of arch support but I can wear it all day. Update: I'm very disappointed in this shoe after wearing it for 3 months or so. The rubber sole has separated from the leather upper - the stitches have torn out. I don't wear them everyday but maybe 3 out of 7. I've tried contacting Sperry to return and replace - but apparently they don't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Kel C

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with Sperrys
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Sperrys for a long time, as as my title states, you can't go wrong. Their quality is always top notch, and this pair is no exception. I bought this same pair in 2013 and to this date it still holds up and has never needed a cleaning or anything. The only reason I purchased new ones is because I needed a bigger size. These shoes are very comfortable, provide a tad arch support, but not much, and are very durable. I recommend to anyone who loves sperrys and to those needing some dependable boat shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BJ1517

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great...
customer_reviews.text: I have had quite a number of Sperrys over the years. In fact I have a pair almost identical to these, in a different color, that I bought about 6 years ago. Frankly, I ma a little disappointed in the quality of materials on these new pair. The padding is a bit thinner, the leather seems not as pliable, and overall construction quality seems to have dropped. I am hoping some of this improves with break-in, but it would be a real shame if Sperry decides to go the "Made in China" route on all its products, and cheapens the build quality. Customers like me WILL notice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are always a good choice if you like the moccasin styling of boat shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of this shoe. These shoes look good and feel good on my feet. Nicely lined and padded insoles. I have high arches, and these shoes give me the support that I need there. My metatarsal arches have some issues, and these shoes give me the extra support that I need there as well. These are my daytime shoes, and the last pair held up well for about a year, maybe longer. Had to get this new pair when the soles wore thin in the middle and no longer provided the support I need for the balls of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: hdfazz

customer_reviews.title: Ultimately disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and wore lightly for about a month. Then all of a sudden the right shoe started popping and clicking with every step. Very annoying. I have had something similar happen before - the steel shank inside the sole had broken and the ends at the break were popping every time I flexed the shoe. Very disappointed that these did not last any time at all before failing me.
customer_reviews.author: IGLASS

customer_reviews.title: Worthless!
customer_reviews.text: These immediately gave me blisters on my heels. I looked at my old pair of TopSider (I've been buying Top Siders for almost 50 years) and the padded back came down the inside and were stitched over the inside of the she leather. The Mako's (which are also Top Siders) have the leather stitched over the padding which leaves a rough leather that can (and in my case did) rubbed the heel and left me with painful, bloody blisters the first time I wore them. Terrible design. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Novak

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed it was just the regular laces
customer_reviews.text: Reason for only three stars, the picture gives the illusion that it doesn't lace up but the laces are permanent there, more as a decoration. I was excited about that as the sperry top sider's biggest problem is the laces never stay tied, because of the thickness of them. So disappointed it was just the regular laces. They should update the picture to reflect what the laces really are.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I first had a pair of Dockers and they were just OK. Lasted for years but time for a new pair. Thought Timberland, the "original boat shoe" should be the best. First pair was too narrow. Next pair was still a little tight but the back of the show was so low that is kept flopping which caused the lo cut socks to shift down under my heal. So, last chance ordering online. Tried the Amazon Choice Sperry Mako. Right out of the box they were the most comfortable boat shoes I have ever had and they look way better than the others. Yeah they were more money but well worth it! Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Wandel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let the negative reviews on other Sperry products dissuade you, these arrived timely and in a Sperry box. Very well made, and comfortable, for the most part. Some heel chafing, but that was expected since I haven’t worn top siders in years. The only negative I’d say, which really isn’t a negative at all, is the Sperry lettering on the rear of the shoe on the tan leather did not have black coloring in some letters. I solved that issue with taking a black ink ballpoint pen and coloring in the letters to have it match. It looks fine after 2 weeks of wearing it on a boat. Definitely recommend these, they’re aesthetic and work with many outfits/colors.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCallister

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, Great Value, Great Quality.
customer_reviews.text: It worked. I was wondering if ordering shoes on line was a good idea. The reviews I read said it ran true to size and width, so I gave it a shot. Happy with the fit. I am also happy with the shoe. I like the raised heel "collar" at the back of the shoe where it meets the back of your ankle. Some boat shoes have been lower causing the shoe to be loose or fall off when running. Lastly, happy with the price. At less than $70 it competes vary favorably with my local shoe stores. Hard to beat value. Bottom Line: I recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W.

customer_reviews.title: Mako comfort
customer_reviews.text: It has been a long time since I have had Sperry's. I find the Mako to be very comfortable and well made. Everyone has personal preferences and in the past couple years I decided to try different brands including Sebago, Timberland and a few wannabe names. Rockport will be next. My experience thus far has been very good with each of the big names and suspect that will continue. I'm not hard on shoes so they are around for a good while. The old adage of "You get what you pay for" still applies for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: My go to shoes
customer_reviews.text: Have bought several pair of these. I like the thicker sole on this model, which makes them more supportive than your basic Sperry. Leather holds up well, looks good. I wear them so much I eventually replace them with more.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bissett

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I got these more than a year ago. They are well made and have held up very well. They are worth the extra bucks. I take care of them, but they still look great and like all deck type loafers, they get more comfortable as time passes by. If you want a long lasting deck shoe, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: T Mat

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Shoe; Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've worn a number of deck shoes from different manufacturers. Most are OK, but many don't last as long as they should. This shoe has all the earmarks of a top quality product - the sole has excellent grip, the leather is strong and well-stitched, the shoe dimensions are what they should be for the human foot, and there is at least some arch support. In addition, the shoe looks great. It should last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: StraightArrow

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am very hard to fit for shoes. This is one shoe that has always fit me. I always remove the insole and replace it with a commercial insole, although the insole that comes with the shoe is adequate. The glue for the soles of the Top Siders I am replacing failed after eight or nine years and I was unable to find a glue to repair them. I do know a cobbler who will sew them on, so they will live on as my seconds.
customer_reviews.author: C. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Nice Casual Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Sperry Boat Shoes for the last 20 years and found them to be comfy. The laces do tend to come un tied alot and then after re tying they do not return to the "new out of the box" look. Upon opening the box on THIS pair I applied small dots of Super Glue to the knotted portion of the laces and they have not come un done. Wiping the shoes with a damp cloth helps maintain the new look.
customer_reviews.author: keno

customer_reviews.title: Very Uncomfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: Very Uncomfortable after wearing for 5 hrs or more & I have to take them off. Cannot wear them all day like I can with my other shoes. Never had this problem before with this type of shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Spaceman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality from Sperry!
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Timberland Kiawah Bay boat shoes that lasted 10 years. Unfortunately, they don't make them anymore. I went to a Timberland outlet store and looked at the Piper Cove boat shoe, quality looked terrible. Decided to try these Sperry Mako's, and when they arrived, quality, fit and finish seemed all top notch. Fit perfect right out of the box. Insole support is terrible if you have a medium or high arch, I put in my orthotics, and it all fits great! We'll see how they last, but for now I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: chicagokidder

customer_reviews.title: Good looking slip on
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes, but they’ll need a break in period even though they are wide I find them tight after wearing them for a while, I expect after wearing them a few times they will be be more comfortable. Other than that they are a great looking shoe and expect them to last a good long time
customer_reviews.author: Ron G.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe - wish they came in genuine wide widths
customer_reviews.text: While Sperry advertises the shoe I purchased as W it was nowhere near wide enough for my 4Es. Pity as it is a good looking and well-made shoe but the company fails to make shoes to fit those of us who require genuine widths. I suspect they are losing quite a bit of business by neglecting the wide shoe market. I gave this shoe 4Es instead of 5 because I think they should produce a true wide fit for those of us who require it.
customer_reviews.author: PAH

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes....but not arch support
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking shoes at a reasonable price. Surprised however that supposedly being "Sperry" brand there was basically no arch support. Otherwise fit good and seem well constructed, but will have to add aftermarket arch support to make comfortable enough to wear regularly.
customer_reviews.author: reddwarf

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap in appearance-leather extremely stiff. Don’t look like they would hold up to daily wear. Chinese made junk. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: J. Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Stitching quality is poor
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 2 months ago and the stitching on the upper is already unraveling in 2 places.
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: shoes ok
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair of these I've owned and they seem as durable as 1st pair I bought 10+yrs. ago. Only difference I can see are some cosmetic changes and the 1st pair was made in China vs. this pair being made in Indonesia. Don't think any shoes are made in US anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made to Last!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about Sperry products? They are made to last!! I purchased these to replace my other Sperry’s which were 34 years old!! This brand is the best for deck shoes so I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Bad Dude

customer_reviews.title: Still Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I got this pair to replace a pair that I've worn for more than 10 years. I ordered the same size but expected the worse. I was pleasantly surprised when I put them on and was able to wear them without socks from day one. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe, Great Service
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Makos. These Topsiders are even more comfortable than the lower level models because they have a contoured foot bed, while looking classy enough to wear as business casual or more. The vendor made these available at a very attractive price, and provided excellent service. I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike N.

customer_reviews.title: Not really "slim."
customer_reviews.text: Although listed as a slim (S) the heel is wide for me. My size 12 does not seem much like a narrow shoe as the slim designation suggests. By tying tightly, I can wear this shoe comfortably enough to get by all day. Other than the loose fit to my narrow foot, this 2-eye "boat" shoe works for me--well constructed and handsome.
customer_reviews.author: Bikeman

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as my other Sperry boat shoess.
customer_reviews.text: The insoles are very uncomfortable. I wore these for about 4 hours in the house and the soles of my feet were hurting after about 30 minutes. I continued wearing them hoping it was just a break-in issue but returned them after 4 hours of continuing discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: From Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great for people with wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: These are replacing a pair I have had for 15 years or more. They were my primary summer shoe. Leather tops & stitching held up extremely well. Rubber soul was becoming brittle and hard so bits would break off. Been wearing Sperry Boat shoes and sneakers for 55 years. They seem to have maintained their quality over the years. And thank heaven they still make shoes for wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First pair of Sperry’s lasted 25 years
customer_reviews.text: I tried a pair of these on while on a trip but the right shoe didn’t feel comfortable, I didn’t try another pair on. I decided to order a pair since the chance of another bad shoe would be unlikely. The price was great and they even fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and fits 4-5E
customer_reviews.text: Good value well made and dressy boat shoe. I replaced a decades deck shoe And this will last as long. This shoe is very good looking well built shoe. At a very good price I love it and happy to have it in my closet.
customer_reviews.author: A. F. Navoff

customer_reviews.title: Two Months and it's already coming apart.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this shoe until they change the "return window" to at least 5-6 months so that it can either come apart or not come apart. Two Months and it's already coming apart. It fits good, but the bottom lacing is already coming out. It is just past my "return window" so I don't know if it can be returned. I like the style and would like to replace if the current shoe was a "lemon".
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Their good
customer_reviews.text: I had my first pair last a long time so I ordered the second. I do add more cushions inside and their comfortable. The only issue is my socks discolored from the die color from the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: pro-tec

customer_reviews.title: incredibly well- made and comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I received this shoe in very good time from an Amazon marketplace partner. the quality of the product is very high, stitching was good, the overall construction was superior, and then foot-bed and sole made for a very comfortable shoe, right out of the box. Many new shoes have a break- in period, but these Sperry top-siders were instantly comfortable (most likely due to the cushion insert in the foot-bed and the sole construction. the sole is thicker than the standard boat shoe, and is better suited for walking on hard surfaces all day. time will tell about their longevity but my initial review is that they are excellent shoes, suitable for business casual, with jeans, or shorts.
customer_reviews.author: Joel B. Ley

customer_reviews.title: full moc construction, good sole pattern
customer_reviews.text: I have had these before and like the style for the real moccasin construction, one piece leather under ball of foot and up the sides. For me this is much better multi part leather, with seam under foot, and plastic sole inserts. There is a heel cushion pad, that works fine. The sole has traction pads in addition to the Sperry wavy slits. For me these wear better and have longer life that standard Sperry sole. I'll buy again when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Drew S.

customer_reviews.title: Bought Again
customer_reviews.text: This purchase replaces this same shoe I purchased a few years ago. The shoe remains the same. It fits consistently without a lot of arch support. For me, it delivers a nice balance of casual comfort with pants or shorts in the office or after hours.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: not the quality of the past
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 20+ year old boat shoes with the new Sperry Mako 2 eye boat shoe. compared to my old shoes the letter is much thinner as is the sole. The box is more shallow and the fit a bit tight. I doubt I'll get another 20 years out of these. Planned obsolescence?
customer_reviews.author: Lois Deitschel

customer_reviews.title: One of the best foot products I have ever owned!!
customer_reviews.text: My second order. These have proven to be the highest quality MOC I have ever worn. Other brands come apart fairly quickly and get really sloppy (especially size 14) . But this product has taken a beating for over a year and still are looking and wearing good. I bought the second pair not because the first ones were worn out, I just wanted too be sure I had a back up pair in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the shoes
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear a EEE width. The D width is a little narrow but these do not come in a wide. However, I had a pair for five years. They stretched out and became very comfortable. I expecting the same. Also, there was a quality defect with the first pair, I called and as soon as I dropped them off at UPS to return them replacements were on the way. I could not be happier with the second pair and the customer service I received.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable - This is my second pair
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are a very personal item, what fits for one person does not for another. This is the second pair of the Top-Sider Mako shoes I've owned, I wore the original pair until I couldn't patch them up any more (and I did make a few repairs). These are, for me, the most comfortable shoes made and I especially look forward to wearing them once they have full "broken in".
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schrauger

customer_reviews.title: Great but there is a break in process
customer_reviews.text: The process to break them is a pain (literally), hurt my feet really bad, but after a while they are pretty comfortable
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Nice boat shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I like the thicker sole. Looks well made and looks like it will hold up. Haven’t worn outside yet looks like it will be comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Nickboughtit

customer_reviews.title: Good Leather Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Got these on sale and am so pleased with them. They fit wonderful and look great too. Appear to be good quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Sam C

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Made, Classic Look, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great boat shoe - very well made; lined, oiled leather, rich color and finish. They feel a touch wide (I ordered Narrow as I usually wear a B), but not bad - very comfy. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: S. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great Sperry Boat shoes
customer_reviews.text: Was very pleasantly surprised at the quality and price of this shoe. I am a dressy/casual guy, and this fits my need perfectly with good looks and comfort
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Pair of Shoes, but . . .
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality boat shoes. However, here are two tips: 1) they run about half a size too large, so I ordered a 10 instead of my usual 10.5, and 2) they're MUCH more comfortable if you add a standard cushion insert -- about $7 at stores like WalMart.
customer_reviews.author: D. B.

customer_reviews.title: Ordering another pair...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair in 2016. I wear them almost constantly. I live in the South, so yes, it's without socks in the summer. I'm ordering a new pair because my new puppy (a 7 month old Golden Doodle named Waldo) decided that they would be good chew toys last night...I'm taking it as a message from the Universe, because I had been thinking that it was time for another pair. I LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: He said they're very comfortable. He typically wears a 13 1/2 wide Brooks ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son. He said they're very comfortable. He typically wears a 13 1/2 wide Brooks sneaker, but I ordered a 13 in this shoe based on the reviews of it running a bit large. The length and width fit of the 13 are more like a size 14 I would say. Still, great shoes that he will wear!
customer_reviews.author: K. Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes. My last pair has held up over ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes. My last pair has held up over 10 years... I use them for outdoor activities where they may be scratched or get very dirty. The only reason I needed new ones was because leather just can't take daily wear without cleaning and conditioning from time to time. But who needs to when you can have a lounging pair and a pair to dress up your jeans or make your khakis or shorts seem more stylish. The styles have changed a bit and the attention to detail isn't quite what I remember, but these are the best game in town under $200.
customer_reviews.author: Xavior

customer_reviews.title: good shoe but color not as depicted, a tad large
customer_reviews.text: The shoe as delivered in color Oak does not appear as pictured, two-toned. The box says Oak and I assume that is what the shoes are, but there is no way for me to know. I have narrow feet and got a 12S which works ok with fairly thick socks. If you want to go barefoot, I'd recommend a half-size lower.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Kreznick

customer_reviews.title: good shoe but not all of the leather color matches
customer_reviews.text: I have previously owned this shoe and liked it. With this new shoe not all of the leather matches color wise. S hoe fits well but I would not buy it again. Inexcusable for a company like Sperry
customer_reviews.author: Hoover's dad

customer_reviews.title: My go to shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I have wide, size 13 feet. This is probably my 6th pair. I've tried many other types but always return to this style of Sperry docksiders. They adapt to my feet and remain comfortable for at least 2 years. There are cheaper Sperry slip ons that don't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOES!
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved these shoes. Just bought a new pair, and so happy to have them. You can simply skip them on and they are very comfortable with good support and no “break-in” time needed.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Lacking in quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, I'm pretty anal when it comes to my shoes. The pic shoes how one sole is larger than the other. Not to mention how far the one sole protrudes from the shoe itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shoes. I wear this to office as office casual (or office very casual, since I wear shorts and go sockless all summer). I had the exact same pair for 5 years that I wore nearly every day before I was forced to replace them (though I'm sure I can still find another use for them for a while before the soles fall off). I wear the amaretto ones, and they're pretty sharp. Very comfortable, well made, high quality. Absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D

customer_reviews.title: Boat shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. They are extremely versatile and go great with every outfit. They are also perfect for sailing and getting wet. The laces are Genuine leather and hold up tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jullian Phipps

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very comfortable and fits as expected. I wear a 10.5 wide and these fit perfectly. The leather still looks good after over a year of wearing the shoes. I love the long lasting sole. It's not the soft rubber found on many loafers. My only complaint is the laces are too short to make a good strong bow tie.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and consistent sizing and fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my SO's 15th or 16th pair of these shoes, lol. He orders them a size larger to accommodate an insert as he is on his feet a good part of the day and cannot wear 'trainers'
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sperry loafers
customer_reviews.text: This is the go to gift in our family very popular and varied styles of color
customer_reviews.author: selective shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoes and their look but not for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: Alas, the shoes were too narrow for my wide feet and I had to return them. Really wish they'd been wider and could have kept them though. When I first put them on they felt really comfortable ands were made well, but after about five minutes I felt the pressure on the sides of my feet and knew they would not "break in." The good ending to the story is that when I commented, I received an e-mail with a return label in just a few minutes. Gotta love Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Sole Issue
customer_reviews.text: This shoe does not last. Sure I bought these 2 1/2 years ago, but they are far from worn out. They are just getting comfortable. The problem is in the sole. See those 3 grooves in front on the arch? The sole splits in those grooves. It is a shame to have a nice thick sole with such a weak area to spoil the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Epic Tuna

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: Well fitting shoe. Differently like the color and the wide option on them. Comfortable indeed and look great in slacks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Colburn

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit as they should too wide
customer_reviews.text: The ahoes they send were too wide in the toe area this is the first time this has ever happened buying these shoes! The label says they are medium width but they are not so maybe they are not original Speerys
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Durable Footware
customer_reviews.text: These "shoes" replace a dearly beloved pair of moccasins and are also my go-to everyday shoes. They fit well, have good arch support and last for years. I wore my previous pair through the grommets coming loose and being repaired, one leather laces snapping which I simply retied, and into a worn down heel before I replaced them with the new models. I'm expecting a similar performance with the new shoes.
customer_reviews.author: amac

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Sperry's never fail. If you've worn them before you know that they are comfortable and fit true to size. Got these new ones after my old ones were looking like I had worn them for years, which I had.
customer_reviews.author: bookprincess

customer_reviews.title: Sperry Top-Siders are my favorite casual shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this make and model boat shoe for over 15 years. You might say I like them. They look smart and have excellent wear characteristics. The only negatives are that it is likely the sole will wear out or the laces will break before the uppers wear out. There is no way to cost-effectively repair/replace the sole. You may find replacing the laces to be a little bit frustrating, but it is doable.
customer_reviews.author: Howard D. Dolginoff

customer_reviews.title: I finally began to really enjoy them and now they're extremely comfortable
customer_reviews.text: At first I have to admit, I was skeptical with the inside of them. They changed the insoles from the last pair I had and they were really rubbery. After a week of wearing them, I finally began to really enjoy them and now they're extremely comfortable. I haven't gotten them wet yet, so I can't comment on that, but definitely an amazing pair. I look forward to having these a few years and then I'll buy another pair as I always do.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Almost indestructible shoes.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is always a bit tight at first, but loosens to just right after break in period. I am in a boat two to three days a week. The shoes get wet and often get sloshed with bait. They wash right off. They are also classy for dress with a pair of chino's. After years, when my boat pair wears out, I move my dress pair to the boat, and get a new pair for dress. They take literally years of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Magnum

customer_reviews.title: Looks good fit is just ok
customer_reviews.text: They are not as comfortable as other Sperry shoes I have worn. Initially the right one was rubbing a bit uncomfortably on my right ankle at the shoe top but wearing them more has made that go away. I like the look but just wish they were a bit more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Pdureska

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of old topsiders I had literally worn out over the years. The moc was starting to separate from the sole, and the soles themselves were work almost through and cracking in places. (This is not a complaint - I don't know how many decades of use I got out of the originals). I was a bit surprised by the color I picked - I was expecting a much darker brown. I could have exchanged them, but decided to keep these lighter ones and they are working out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit was good, albeit an advertised 11ee was just an 11 ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit was good, albeit an advertised 11ee was just an 11 wide (eee) wide I know will loosen up a bit after some wear, so I would have preferred an actual 11 ee. Price was essentially full retail, but I had trouble finding these in either an 11ee or 11 wide, so I just paid up, thus with the sizing misadvertisement, 4 vs 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This was my third pair that I bought. The shoes are great for everyday casual style. They usually last about 3 years of wearing them almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie & Jeanne Silva

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoes at a fair price. Sperry Mako Topsider two-eye
customer_reviews.text: Used as my dress shoes. I have a pair of this same model in a lighter tone. Great shoes. I'm happy to have a good experience buying them online.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I really like the style of these shoes but I am only ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the style of these shoes but I am only giving them 4 stars. The pair I recevied has very little arch support. I like the overall construction of the Sperry shoes and the quality of the shoe. I will look at getting something to support my arch because I really like the overall shoe, just be aware if you need a high arch support these will not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tony A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I have been buying this shoe for several years and they are always perfect. I'll continue to buy them in the future. Don't change them.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fit and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair as I wear them every day. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Buckwalter Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I like them!
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of these- took me over 5 years to wear the first ones out. The laces on these have always been a little fussy to get right, but when they are broken in they hold tight when you want them to and slip off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Boo

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a finely made shoe. I bought it for my husband based on the size of his last pair of Sperry's. He wore them for a while and then could not wear them anymore because they rubbed on his heel. I'd return them but they have obviously been used. Do not know why one pair would fit and another not when they are the same style. The shoe itself is quite handsome.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Barker

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe for the money
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. Hope it last as long as my last pair
customer_reviews.author: Trickster

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these everyday now-my new favorite. Super comfortable and with a slightly thicker sole, they feel great. Great value!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feel like flip flops, I love Sperry too
customer_reviews.text: I think the leather is the issue, they are ok, but just not what I was expecting, again, maybe its the whole leather issue but they didnt feel anchored at all.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sunther

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the doubters; these met every expectation
customer_reviews.text: I know a few reviewers here have said the quality of this shoe has declined, but I don't see it. I just bought a pair to replace a well-worn pair of the same model purchased about 8 years ago. The new pair is great in every respect and I couldn't be happier. Fit, finish, and quality all meet what I would expect from Sperry.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these boat shoes. Great shoes.Good looking and very comfortable deck shoe.These will be my second pair of Sperry Top-Sider Men's Mako 2-Eye Canoe. They are fabulous shoes that fit from the first time you put them and stay comfortable throughout their useful life. The second pair finally wore out after six years of every day wear.
customer_reviews.author: Eduard

customer_reviews.title: Very satisified with the shoes and the service.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes online to replace the pair I bought in a store in April 2013. The fit is as expected. The actual style of this model has been imporved. I'm very satisified with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dick C. in Indy

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes - Second pair.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, quality as usual. This is the second pair. The first pair lasted for at least 7 years. The soles finally worn smooth, but the tops still look great.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Classic Boatshoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd pair we have bought , the 1st was from Maceys and we found the same pair here !!! The 1st lasted 4 yrs and still can be worn but wanted a fresh look !!! Classic Boatshoe
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting it to look nicer with the price being so high, but they still look pretty good
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: 3rd pair of these I've owned, great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair of these I've owned, love them. the order came sooner than advised and as expected, same quality I've expect from Sperry..
customer_reviews.author: Sbagwell

customer_reviews.title: Loved it! Used to buying shoes in store
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! Used to buying shoes in store, but never find my size or the look. Knowing I can buy a shoe online without driving everywhere to find it, wondering if I paid too much, worrying about sales and coupons, and all the other challenges of buying in store is a god send. As a guy I Ike to wear nice clothes and shoes but I'm not willing to put the time and effort in to drive everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: AL_Fires

customer_reviews.title: Sharp casual shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is a beauty, a little stiff, but some mini oil and use should loosen up
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sperry brand boat shoes are the best made and last longer
customer_reviews.text: This pair replaced Mako 2 eye boat shoe purchased 10 years ago. Wear them for any occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Parker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very pleased with these shoes. The style, fit and comfort were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: On the Go

customer_reviews.title: liked previous version better
customer_reviews.text: liked previous version better. the tongue tends to slip down when you pit it on requiring you to sit down and untie and retie this slip-on boat shoe. Kinda defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond H Ackley

customer_reviews.title: Top-shelf shoes from a top-shelf maker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit, style and construction--which is to be expected of the manufacturer (established 85 yrs. ago). The shoes were so good, I ordered another pair for my work shoe rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan N.

customer_reviews.title: Makos  last forever.  Look great and feel comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The Mako starts out an eighth of an inch too long but in less than a month it's going to shrink to fit your foot so don't buy it too small. Just wear them inside like slippers for the first three weeks all day long and then they will fit your foot perfectly. This is my third pair in 10 years. I still have the first two pairs you cannot wear them out. Use them for working in the yard and fishing and such. The new ones look great with Gap or Cinch jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Sperry's for daily use
customer_reviews.text: The standard Sperry Topsider is an excellent boat shoe, light, comfortable, surefooted, even in wet conditions, and the light colored sole is easy on gel coat decks. However the thin sole that makes it so light creates an uncomfortable shoe for walking or everyday use. This stylish shoe, while somewhat heavier, combines the advantages of the original with a thick cushioned sole that make it a good choice for walking and daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfort, never disappoints !
customer_reviews.text: Never go wrong with these shoes, great fit. Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McDowall

customer_reviews.title: they look good.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes for a boating trip that I was leaving on the day after they arrived. My fault for not returning them, but I needed the boat sole so took them with me. I wear a size 9 street shoe and a size 10 running shoe, so I ordered a size 9 in the boat shoe. With a pair of regular socks, I was walking right out of them. I had to put on a pair of thick sweat socks and the street shoe socks on top to get them to fit. No socks, as some wear these, is out of the question. BUT.....they look good.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Adalian

customer_reviews.title: Boat shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are replacing a well worn pair just like them....
customer_reviews.author: D. Haynes

product_meta.title: Sperry Men's Mako 2-Eye Boat Shoe
product_meta.description:
With enhanced comfort and support, the Mako is the worlds first boat shoe as rugged as a shark.

Best known for boat shoes that have logged more miles of open ocean than any other brand, the Sperry Top-Sider story began on a raw winter day in New England. When avid sailor and hobbyist inventor Paul Sperry let his dog Prince out for his daily exercise, he noticed that the cocker spaniel was remarkably stable, even at a full run on the snow covered, icy crust. Paul raced back to his laboratory to begin working. Using pieces of rubber, a razor blade, and an ordinary sneaker, Paul had soon pieced together the prototype of the world's first boat shoe. Subsequent designs yielded the original Sperry Top-Sider now known as the Authentic Original. Since 1935, Sperry Top-Sider has been the leading brand of footwear for those who love the water. From its introduction of the world's first siped rubber outsole for non-marking traction, to its advanced technical fabrication to combat the elements, Sperry Top-Sider remains the vanguard of high-performance amphibious footwear. Available around the globe in fine independent, marine, and department stores, Sperry Top-Sider is the official footwear of the U.S. Sailing Team, Zodiac Academy, the World Billfish Series, and the Shimano Fishing Tour.
feature_bullets: Classic boat shoe featuring 360-degree lacing system with rust-proof eyelets and logo patch on tongue
Dual-density bottom with cushion midsole for under-foot comfort
Non-marking rubber outsole with razor cut Wave-Siping for traction
